wv
  • Reference

Wavelet Variance

Calculates the (MODWT) wavelet variance

wvar(x, ...)

# S3 method for default
wvar(x, decomp = "modwt", filter = "haar",
  nlevels = NULL, alpha = 0.05, robust = FALSE, eff = 0.6, freq = 1,
  from.unit = NULL, to.unit = NULL, ...)

Arguments

x

A vector with dimensions N x 1.
...

Further arguments passed to or from other methods.
decomp

A string that indicates whether to use the "dwt" or "modwt" decomposition.
filter

A string that specifies what wavelet filter to use.
nlevels

An integer that indicates the level of decomposition. It must be less than or equal to floor(log2(length(x))).
alpha

A double that indicates the \(\left(1-p\right)*\alpha\) confidence level
robust

A boolean that triggers the use of the robust estimate.
eff

A double that indicates the efficiency as it relates to an MLE.
freq

A numeric that provides the rate of samples.
from.unit

A string indicating the unit which the data is converted from.
to.unit

A string indicating the unit which the data is converted to.

Value

A list with the structure:

"variance"

Wavelet Variance

"ci_low"

Lower CI

"ci_high"

Upper CI

"robust"

Robust active

"eff"

Efficiency level for Robust

"alpha"

p value used for CI

"unit"

String representation of the unit

Details

If nlevels is not specified, it is set to \(\left\lfloor {{{\log }_2}\left( {length\left( x \right)} \right)} \right\rfloor\)

Examples

set.seed(999)
x = rnorm(100)
# Default
wvar(x)
#>       Variance      Low CI   High CI
#> 2  0.452177820 0.316045047 0.7004281
#> 4  0.230339706 0.140751059 0.4440086
#> 8  0.137102522 0.069880858 0.3811887
#> 16 0.051603837 0.020543745 0.2878292
#> 32 0.011723825 0.003282007 0.3685303
#> 64 0.008205545 0.001633306 8.3553640

# Robust
wvar(x, robust = TRUE, eff=0.3)
#>        Variance       Low CI   High CI
#> 2  0.5497985611 0.2475972071 1.1008897
#> 4  0.2399470986 0.0695590832 0.6463224
#> 8  0.1317999689 0.0138172248 0.5602029
#> 16 0.0619567778 0.0138172248 0.5797696
#> 32 0.0074844382 0.0037422191 0.4233586
#> 64 0.0004697035 0.0002348517 0.8728270

# Classical
wvar(x, robust = FALSE, eff=0.3)
#>       Variance      Low CI   High CI
#> 2  0.452177820 0.316045047 0.7004281
#> 4  0.230339706 0.140751059 0.4440086
#> 8  0.137102522 0.069880858 0.3811887
#> 16 0.051603837 0.020543745 0.2878292
#> 32 0.011723825 0.003282007 0.3685303
#> 64 0.008205545 0.001633306 8.3553640

# 90% Confidence Interval 
wvar(x, alpha = 0.10)
#>       Variance      Low CI   High CI
#> 2  0.452177820 0.334461347 0.6516656
#> 4  0.230339706 0.152096918 0.3978812
#> 8  0.137102522 0.077666345 0.3200430
#> 16 0.051603837 0.023732362 0.2119612
#> 32 0.011723825 0.004018555 0.1908247
#> 64 0.008205545 0.002136049 2.0867886
